races.name: Dwarf
races.description: Sturdy and strong, dwarves are known for their resilience and craftsmanship. They typically live underground in clans and are skilled miners and artisans.

races.name: Elf
races.description: Graceful and agile beings with a deep connection to nature and magic, elves often dwell in forests or other natural settings.

races.name: Halfling
races.description: Small and cheerful folk known for their luck and stealthiness, halflings often live in rural communities or travel as adventurers.

races.name: Human
races.description: Versatile and adaptable, humans are found in all corners of the world, with a wide range of cultures, backgrounds, and ethnicities.

races.name: Dragonborn
races.description: Humanoid creatures with draconic ancestry, dragonborn have scales, claws, and sometimes even breath weapons reminiscent of dragons. They are proud and honorable beings.

races.name: Gnome
races.description: Small and inventive creatures with a knack for tinkering and magic, gnomes are curious and whimsical beings who often live in hidden communities or among other races.

races.name: Half-Elf
races.description: Offspring of humans and elves, half-elves possess traits of both races. They often feel torn between their human and elven heritage, but they are adaptable and charismatic individuals.

races.name: Half-Orc
races.description: Offspring of humans and orcs, half-orcs are strong and resilient, often misunderstood due to their orcish ancestry. Despite stereotypes, they can be loyal companions and formidable warriors.

races.name: Tiefling
races.description: Descended from fiends or with fiendish ancestry, tieflings often have distinctive features such as horns, tails, or unusual skin tones. They are often mistrusted due to their infernal heritage but can be driven by noble or personal motivations.
